channel.title: Zenithscape client
channel.description:
When I run this client locally, It runs fine, But then I change it to my servers IP And upload it for people to download (After compiling of course) When someone else trys to run it, It says "Checking for updates - 1%" and never finishes. This is running on the same port as any other source, where they can connect fine, So I know that it's not a portfowarding problem on my part. It's something else. Can someone please tell me how to fix this?
Here's the Problem:
[IMG]http://i763.photobucket.com/albums/xx273/v1nch3nz0/Untitled-13.png[/img]

item.title: Zenithscape client
item.dc:creator: @Exorcism Exorcism
item.description:
@Exorcism wrote:

I have the same problem I can play on it fine but when people try to join it just says “Checking For Updates 1%”. I have changed the ip in the Loader.java and the Gamestub.java but have had no success

Read full topic

item.title: Zenithscape client
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

try .zip the cache folder upload it to dropbox & then change the link in cachedownloader.java

Read full topic

item.title: Zenithscape client
item.dc:creator: @V_1_N_C_H V 1 N C H
item.description:
@V_1_N_C_H wrote:

It is not, and I obviously have no-ip. The only thing I change between this and my other source is what Im running. They can connect through the same port on another client to a different source just fine, but when I run this, It does not work. I have changed every IP possible. It is internal.

Read full topic

item.title: Zenithscape client
item.dc:creator: @Rotavele Rotavele
item.description:
@Rotavele wrote:

Do you have a No-IP? if you do is it correctly done?

If so then, make sure your client has the exact IP, compile it, and then run it. If the problem is still there and your server is running, then it has to be a portforward issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Zenithscape client
item.dc:creator: @fpsnipmob fpsnipmob
item.description:
@fpsnipmob wrote:

I can assure you its not a Portforwarding issue, its internel

Read full topic
